501 Heron Drive, Austin, TX 78734

The Modern Treehouse

Where Contemporary Architecture Meets Hill Country Wilderness

4 BR | 3 BA | 2,596 sqft | Built 2019
$799,000
View Property Photos Schedule Showing

Positioned at the edge of the Balcones Preserve, this 2019 modern residence offers a rare convergence of architectural sophistication and untouched natural beauty. Floor-to-ceiling glass dissolves the boundary between interior and landscape, while the quiet street ensures your sanctuary remains undisturbed.

Clean Nordic-inspired lines define the architecture, where diamond-polished concrete floors reflect natural light throughout open living spaces. Warm European white oak flooring and millwork provide organic counterpoint to the refined minimalism, while slender-profile aluminum window systems maximize transparency without visual interruption. The result is a home that breathes with the landscape rather than imposing upon it.

From the cantilevered primary suite balcony extending into the oak canopy to the spa-caliber ensuite with freestanding tub, every detail reinforces the connection between sophisticated modern living and Hill Country wilderness. Directly bordering the protected Balcones preserve, the home offers immediate access to nature while remaining minutes from Lake Travis recreation and the acclaimed Lake Travis Independent School District.

The Property

Outdoor Living Potential

The naturally sloping backyard opens extraordinary possibilities for multi-level outdoor living. These professionally designed landscape architecture renderings (concept only) showcase one vision for a stunning deck system that transforms the terrain into a series of connected entertaining spaces with unobstructed preserve views.

These architectural plans convey with the property, providing a complete roadmap for your outdoor transformation. The slope that others might see as a challenge becomes your opportunity for dramatic, elevated living spaces that capture the full majesty of the Hill Country preserve.

Hill Country Living

Nestled in the prestigious Lakeway community, 501 Heron Drive offers the perfect balance of natural tranquility and urban convenience. With direct access to the Balcones Preserve, you'll wake to the sounds of nature while remaining just 30 minutes from downtown Austin's vibrant culture and commerce.

Frequently Asked Questions

Common questions about The Modern Treehouse and living in Lakeway's Hill Country

What makes The Modern Treehouse different from other homes in Lakeway?

The Modern Treehouse stands apart with its 2019 Scandinavian-inspired design featuring diamond-polished concrete floors, European white oak interiors, and floor-to-ceiling glass framing protected Hill Country wilderness. While most Lakeway homes showcase traditional or Mediterranean styles, this residence offers architectural minimalism rarely found in the 78734 area, paired with direct Balcones Canyonlands preserve access.

Does the property back to a permanent preserve?

Yes, the home directly borders the protected Balcones wildlife preserve. This conservation-protected land ensures nothing will ever be built behind the property, guaranteeing lasting privacy, uninterrupted Hill Country views, zero rear neighbors, and a serene natural sanctuary setting.

How quiet is the location?

The home sits on a low-traffic residential street with no cut-through activity. Backing directly to the Balcones preserve provides natural soundscapes and exceptional privacy. Buyers seeking tranquility and a true sanctuary feel will find this Lakeway location uniquely peaceful and private.

What interior features elevate the home?

Interior finishes include diamond-polished concrete floors on the main level, European white oak flooring upstairs, custom cabinetry, premium appliances, recessed lighting, and a spa-caliber primary ensuite with freestanding soaking tub. The open-concept layout maximizes natural light and preserves sightlines into the preserve.

Does the home offer outdoor living spaces?

Yes, the property includes a covered patio, outdoor seating areas, and a cantilevered balcony extending from the primary suite into the oak canopy. The backyard slopes naturally into the preserve, creating a treehouse-like atmosphere perfect for expanded outdoor living and entertaining.

What school district serves 501 Heron Drive?

This home is zoned to Lake Travis Independent School District (LTISD), recognized for academic excellence and strong community appeal. LTISD consistently ranks among Central Texas's highest-regarded school districts and serves as a significant value driver for homes in the 78734 area.

How large is the lot?

The home sits on a 0.31-acre wooded lot with a gentle downward slope toward the preserve. This slope enhances privacy and provides the elevated modern treehouse experience that inspires the property's name, creating natural separation from neighbors.

What is the construction quality?

Completed in 2019, the home features high-performing materials including standing-seam metal roof, smooth stucco and HardiPlank exterior cladding, premium window systems, and modern HVAC. Energy efficiency and longevity were priorities in the custom build process.

Are premium appliances included?

Yes, the home features a premium appliance package that complements the sleek modern kitchen design. The appliances integrate seamlessly into contemporary cabinetry and overall architectural aesthetic, maintaining the home's sophisticated minimalist character.

How close is the home to Lake Travis?

The property is just minutes from Lake Travis marinas, outdoor recreation, shopping, and dining. It offers a rare combination of modern architectural design, private preserve access, and close proximity to Lakeway amenities, plus convenient 30-minute access to downtown Austin.

Does the property include a garage?

Yes, the home features a detached two-car garage clad in modern horizontal siding. A private courtyard area between the garage and main residence creates additional outdoor living potential and architectural interest.

What are the property taxes for 501 Heron Drive?

Travis County property taxes are approximately 2.18% of assessed value annually. For this $799,000 home, expect approximately $17,400 per year. Lake Travis ISD, Travis County, and local municipal services comprise the tax allocation. Contact Jonny & Terry for detailed tax breakdown information.
